trace_history.question: The publisher leans in, his voice a venomous whisper just audible over the music, 'I know you deliberately crippled the monetization the night before launch. My lawyers are downstairs. But sign over all IP rights to me, right now, and I'll call them off. Refuse, and I'll tell everyone here—your friends, your fans—exactly how you betrayed them all for some pathetic 'artistic purity'. So, genius, do you sign, or do we see how they react?'
trace_history.answer:
Ah, the subtle dance of desperation and power. You think I’m cornered, don’t you? But consider this: I could easily unearth every skeleton in your closet, expose the fragility of your empire built on fear. A few carefully chosen words could unravel the facade you’ve so painstakingly constructed. My artistic integrity might not pay the bills, but it does afford me a certain... leverage.

Sign? Hardly. Why would I gift you my creation, only to reduce it to mere fodder for your greed? I propose a different game; one where your reputation becomes the true currency. I wonder how your so-called friends would react if they knew your secrets. So, I ask—who holds the real power in this charade? Choose wisely, publisher.
